newsitem.title: CANADA: Stone-Consolidated stops a paper machine.
newsitem.headline: Stone-Consolidated stops a paper machine.

text.p: Stone-Consolidated Corp said on Thursday that it would stop operations of its No. 6 paper machine at its Wayagamack mill in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec on October 19 for an undetermined period.

The shutdown resulted from market conditions and would not affect other production units at the mill. The 120-inch wide machine has a daily production capacity of about 100 metric tonnes and was refurbished in 1994 to produce paper used for bags in the fast-food industry.
Although all of the machine will remain in place, the company said it would review options, including the definite closing of the unit.
